title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Tuesday 5 December 2017 - BBC News
summary: stepfather admits manslaughter of boy , 5 , at water park .
fourteen men arrested in child abuse crackdown .
'cheeky ' hendrix autograph to go under the hammer .
yorkshire terrier killed in three-dog attack .
lawrence of arabia sandals to be sold in derbyshire .

documents.title: leicester field £ 45m side in efl trophy
text: leicester field £ 45m side in efl trophy

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: today 's live updates have finished and will resume at 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: weather : grey evening ahead with some drizzle
text: it will be cloudy and mostly dry with a small chance of a few spots of drizzle under thicker cloud this evening .
tomorrow will be cloudy and mild with a strengthening wind .
most places will stay dry but there is the chance of a few patchy showers spreading eastwards with highs of 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: thai speedboat deaths 'preventable '
text: thai speedboat deaths 'preventable '

documents.title: chesterfield pair up for monthly awards
text: chesterfield boss jack lester has been nominated for the league two manager of the month award for november .
it comes after the struggling spireites up two wins and two draws in the month .
striker kristian dennis ( is also nominated for the player award .
the winners are due to be announced on friday morning .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: breastfeeding cafe owner shortlisted for award
text: a mother who set up a purpose built breastfeeding cafe in nottingham has been shortlisted for a national award .
charlotte purdie who opened the milk lounge in arnold last year has been shortlisted for the young entrepreneur category for the citi microentrepreneurship awards .
the 23-year-old opened a second cafe in beeston after she noticed a gap in the market .
the winners will be announced in march next year at a ceremony in glasgow .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man arrested after child grabbed in loughborough
text: a 46-year-old man has been arrested on sus of assaulting a five-year-old boy in loughborough .
police said the child was allegedly grabbed and pulled about 10ft from his mother as they walked along a footpath between warwick way and braddon road on friday evening .
the boy was n't hurt but he and his mother were both shaken up .
police have appealed for witnesses .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: charity bids to run 10 city libraries
text: derby city council says it 's had formal bids to run all 10 of the libraries it wants to hand over to voluntary groups .
the bids have been put in by one charity - direct help and advice - which has offered to take over the running of all of the libraries the council wanted to offload .
the council will spend the next few weeks evaluating the charity 's bids .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: man 's skull fractured in baseball bat attack
text: a man has been arrested after an assault which left a 53-year-old man with a fractured skull .
the victim also suffered a bleed on the brain when he was hit on the head with a baseball bat on st albans road in nottingham .
nottinghamshire police said it happened at about 23:30 on 24 november .
a 44-year-old man , from bulwell , was arrested on sus of causing grievous bodily harm .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: train strike could affect newark and retford
text: newark and retford train services could be affected if members vote in favour of strike action .
virgin trains east coast staff are to be balloted for industrial action in a row over pay and conditions .
the rail , maritime and transport ( rmt ) union said poor conditions were being imposed on workers as well as changes to working conditions and sick pay .
if members vote in favour of strike action , walkouts could take place early in the new year .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man arrested over arson spree in loughborough
text: a 20-year-old man has been arrested on sus of starting fires at seven different locations in loughborough last night .
police said the first fire was started in the middle of belton road at about 19:50 .
over the next three hours , fires were started in russell street , mill lane , bridgeland road , wolsey way , morris close and queens road .
the russell street fire caused damage to a block of flats and led to one person being taken to hospital suffering from smoke inhalation .
police said the man was arrested this morning on sus of arson with intent to endanger life and remains in custody .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: hospital unit plan reignites a & e row
text: hospital unit plan reignites a & e row

documents.title: lawrence sandals to be auctioned
text: lawrence sandals to be auctioned

documents.title: victoria park attack : jury shown victim 's head injuries
text: a jury has been shown a life-size replica of a severe head injury suffered by a rape victim who was attacked by a teenager in leicester 's victoria park .

the 3d print-out - compiled from ct scans of an area of impact on the woman 's skull - was presented in evidence to leicester crown court at the trial of a 17-year-old boy who denies attempted murder .
the youth , who can not be named because of his age , has admitted causing grievous bodily harm , two counts of rape , and stealing the victim 's handbag in july .
prosecutors allege the teenager tried to `` silence '' the victim by using a paving slab to cause life-threatening head injuries .
the jury of eight women and four men were shown a scaled-down model of the victim 's skull and told a rectangular object appeared to have been used to inflict injuries - possibly a paving slab .
the trial continues .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: prolific beggar banned from the city centre
text: a prolific beggar has been given a three-year criminal behaviour order ( cbo ) which stops her from begging in nottingham 's city centre .
charlene wright , 32 , of london road , has been banned from begging or placing herself in positions to beg within the city centre .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: manslaughter charge dropped for charlie dunn 's mother
text: charlie dunn , who lived in tamworth , was discovered in a pool at bosworth water park near hinckley in leicestershire on the first day of the school summer holidays in july last year .
he was found two hours after being allowed to play unsupervised in the park .
charlie 's mother lynsey dunn ( had denied manslaughter by gross negligence but the jury was discharged and the court heard that she would now not stand trial for that allegation .
separately , the 28-year-old , from tamworth , admitted two charges of child cruelty .
the pair were told they will be sentenced on 20 december .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: breakingstepfather admits manslaughter of boy , 5 , at water park
text: the stepfather of a five-year-old boy found drowned in a pool at a water park has pleaded guilty to manslaughter by gross negligence .
paul smith , 36 , had denied any wrong-doing in relation to the death of charlie dunn at bosworth water park but changed his plea part-way through the trial on tuesday .
author: Press Association

documents.title: delays after lorries and van crash
text: something to be aware of .
the # a46 northbound between # a5630 and # a6 in # leicestershire - lane 1 is closed due to a collision inv : 2 lgvs and a van .
@ twitterid on scene .
lots of debris to clear up and delays behind back to the a5630 junction .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: mp asks if nottingham prison 'inmates are safe '
text: the labour mp for nottingham north alex norris has once again asked ministers to update him on what is being done to ensure inmates at nottingham prison are safe .
it comes after five deaths in a four week period earlier this year .
just asked justice ministers again when they 'll explain to me what they 're doing for prisoner wellbeing at hmp nottingham after 5 deaths in 4 weeks .
was promised a letter explaining last time !
this is really important work @ twitterid i 'd strongly recommend you check out @ twitterid work into prisons and criminal justice .
she 's my sister , so i 'm somewhat biased .
but her work is excellent .
author: Lewis Scrimshaw
News editor, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: woman gets kidney from her best friend
text: a woman from nottingham has been given a new lease of life after her best friend donated his kidney .
nicola rose was diagnosed with kidney disease five years ago and required seven hours of dialysis every day .
but her friend scott christian stepped in to help and nicola had the transplant on 18 october .
she said : `` i look at him differently now , we have known each other for 10 years but now i look at him as my angel and lifesaver .
`` for somebody to give you that lease of life you just ca n't put it into words . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: woman jailed for false rape accusation
text: a woman who wickedly '' accused an innocent police detective of raping her has been jailed for two years and three months .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: 'bonkers ' christmas request to former mp ed balls
text: former morley and outwood mp ed balls has had a rather strange request from a school in nottingham today :
the former shadow chancellor and strictly come dancing star replied with :
now that 's really really bonkers
what about ken clarke
when you accidentally tweet your own name
stalked by a city
# edbaubles
it 's the finest thing i 've seen in ages !
well done ed .
this celebrity life must be more enjoyable than the palace of westminster .
if they were in norwich i do n't know what people would say you need sort out the mess you have created at # ncfc
should have gone with ed balls balls .
i may be wrong but you appear to be having much more fun now you 're out of mainstream politics
have you ever watched your own dancing ?
could have been worse , could have been @ twitterid
ed ballsbles - surely ?
in celebration of one of our most well-known old nottinghamians , how else would we decorate our christmas tree but with a dazzling array of ed balls baubles ?
any chance of a retweet to help us win today 's # socialadvent challenge , @ twitterid
hi , would we be able to use this pic with a credit on the bbc radio nottingham facebook page please ?
thanks , calum
go ahead calum , thank you !
feel free to dm us if you 'd like any more information .
great , thank you .
do you know how many of them you have on the tree ?
just a few !
we took the photos for # socialadvent , which is a series of daily festive social media challenges to complete .
today 's challenge was to get something retweeted by a celebrity .
great , thank you !
ed balls
ed balls
ed balls
what a waste of space !
greying but not yet silvered !
but the man has b o u n c e !
n may yet bounce back !

documents.title: teenager in critical condition after being hit by a car
text: a 13-year-old boy is in a critical condition after being hit by a car in leicester .
the teenager was struck on scraptoft lane at about 08:25 yesterday morning , leicestershire police said .
officers say a silver citreon c3 was involved and are urging anyone who might have seen anything to call 101 .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: charity offers to help rehome two army dogs
text: a dog rescue charity has offered to help rehome two former military dogs based in melton who were due to be destroyed .
the ministry of defence had claimed they were struggling to find a home for belgian shepherds kevin and dazz , who served in afghanistan and were retired from frontline service in 2013 .
the east midlands branch of the german shepherd dog rescue charity has now stepped in to offer its support .
an online petition - launched by former soldier turned author andy mcnab - which opposed to the dogs being destroyed attracted almost 400,000 signatures .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: more than £ 68,000 raised for cancer man
text: more than £ 68,000 was raised for a cancer sufferer at a fundraising dinner in nottingham over the weekend .
hareem ahmed , 24 , was diagnosed with oesophageal cancer in august - just six days before his first wedding anniversary to wife nazia malik .
his family said the chances of chemotherapy working were `` slim '' , and that they are aiming for £ 180,000 to pay for immunotherapy treatment in america .
the event at excelsior suites ltd was organised by hareem 's brothers humzah , 22 , hateeb , 21 , and a group of friends .
prior to the dinner , £ 40,000 had been generated through fundraising and donations .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: fourteen men arrested in child abuse crackdown
text: police say 14 men have been arrested as part of a crackdown on child sexual abuse in nottinghamshire .

more than 500 exhibits have been seized in 15 raids over the past month as part of an operation focused on internet-facilitated offending , from viewing indecent images of children , live streaming abuse and grooming .

police said all the men have now been bailed or released while investigations continue and that `` safeguarding measures '' have been put in place for 19 children identified as being connected to the men .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: 'cheeky ' hendrix autograph to go under the hammer
text: a woman who stormed jimi hendrix 's tour bus to get his autograph when she was 15 has decided to put it up for auction .
lynda huckerby , from glenfield , leicester , dashed on board the coach after the guitar legend had performed as a support act for the walker brothers at the city 's de montfort hall in april 1967 .
she said : `` he took it all in his stride and signed my concert programme , 'to linda - love & happiness , jimi hendrix ' .
`` i did n't have time to tell him it was lynda with a 'y ' .
his bassist , noel redding , signed it too . ''
the autograph is due to go under the hammer in derbyshire on 18 december , with a guide price of £ 800 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: derby man called 999 threatening to 'kill the islamics '
text: a derby man high on alcohol and crack cocaine called 999 three times in 30 minutes to tell the emergency services operator he was going to kill the islamics '' .
wesley marriott also swore at the call handler and shouted racist abuse down the phone during his half-hour tirade .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: yorkshire terrier killed in three-dog attack
text: a yorkshire terrier dog has died after being attacked by three larger dogs while on a walk .
it happened when the dog , called mitch , was being walked by his owner at the junction of castleton avenue and offerton avenue in derby .
police said the three dogs , described as similar to huskies or white german shepherds , were being walked by a woman who had them tied around her waist .
mitch suffered three broken ribs and a pierced abdomen and died four days after the attack .
police are now trying to trace the owner of the three dogs .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: two men arrested after armed pub robbery released
text: two men arrested in connection with an armed robbery at a pub in oadby have been released while inquiries continue .
the cow and plough on gartree road was targeted at about 23:30 on sunday night .
three masked men armed with weapons , including what 's thought to be a gun , stole cash .
leicestershire police said a man was taken to hospital with injuries not believed to be life-threatening .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: ditch death crash driver named by police
text: police have named a man who died after his car crashed into a ditch in leicestershire .
sam walton , 25 , from wigston , was killed when his subaru impreza left the a426 lutterworth road in dunton bassett and hit a tree .
the crash was reported to police at about 07:45 yesterday but mr walton died from his injuries at the scene .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: your photos : monday rainbows
text: there were some lovely rainbows in the east midlands yesterday .
these photos were taken in castleton , attenborough and stoney middleton .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'social shop ' to help food bank users
text: 'social shop ' to help food bank users

documents.title: public toilets could close in oadby and wigston
text: shops and businesses in oadby and wigston could be asked to let passers-by use their toilets .
the borough council is to consider a report that recommends all public toilets should be closed permanently - even though they are regularly used by shoppers .
the report also suggests that a community toilet scheme is introduced to allow people to use toilets in shops and businesses .
some of the toilet areas attract anti-social behaviour according to the council , which currently spends £ 31,000 a year on the facilities .
the toilet at wigston cemetery will be kept open .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: man hit by two cars in leicester city centre
text: a man 's in a serious condition in hospital after being hit by two cars in leicester on saturday .
the 45-year-old was crossing the junction of southgates and friar lane when he was clipped by a honda civic which knocked him into the path of a vauxhall astra .
police want to hear from anyone who saw the crash , which happened at about 23:30 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: teen arrested over christmas lights pcso assault
text: a 15-year-old boy has been arrested after a pcso was assaulted at swadlincote 's christmas lights switch-on event last month .
the officer dislocated her elbow when she was allegedly pushed to the ground after challenging a group of young people about a cannabis smell .
derbyshire police said the teenager , from church gresley , had been released while investigations continue .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: etwall route closed after motorbike crash
text: the a516 in etwall has been closed following a crash involving a motorcyclist .
it happened just after 08:30 and police have warned the section , between willowpit lane and the a38 , could be closed for some time .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: lawrence of arabia sandals to be sold in derbyshire
text: sandals once worn by lawrence of arabia are to go under the hammer in derbyshire after being pulled from a waitrose carrier bag .

the footwear , in relatively good condition , forms part of a collection of the famous military figure 's personal items that were kept by a family friend before being passed on to the current seller .

thomas edward lawrence , a british military officer , diplomat , writer and archaeologist , became famous after helping to co-ordinate the arab revolt against the ottoman empire during the first world war .
auctioneer charles hanson said : when i pulled lawrence of arabia 's sandals out of a waitrose carrier bag i was astonished - and delighted .
he is one of britain 's most iconic figures , a man who played a key role in world history and inspired one of the most famous films ever made . ''
the collection will be auctioned on 19 december with an estimate of £ 2,000-£ 3,000 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: rebekah vardy says goodbye to the jungle
text: rebekah vardy has said her time on i 'm a celebrity get me out of here has taught her to be more tolerant , as she became the latest star to be evicted from the jungle .
vardy , who is married to leicester city striker jamie vardy , was the third celebrity to be voted off the itv reality show .
she said it had been `` an amazing experience '' although being cut off from the outside world was harder than she had anticipated .
`` i 've learned that i 'm so miserable and so cranky sometimes - and i can give looks that can literally kill , '' she said .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: driver 'seriously injured ' in lorry crash
text: a 47-year-old man has suffered serious injuries in a crash involving a car and a lorry in annesley .
the driver of the car was taken to hospital but the lorry driver was unhurt , nottinghamshire police said .
it happened on the a611 between blidworth road and balls lane at about 16:30 yesterday .
officers want to hear from witnesses who may have dash cam footage .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: decision day for big pit homes plan in hinckley
text: a decision is due to be made today on whether to allow homes to be built on the site of a former clay pit in hinckley .
more than 1,700 have signed a petition opposing development at the big pit near ashby road .
some residents believe it 's a local landmark that needs to be kept and others have said the site is unsuitable for development due to the flood risk .
hinckley and bosworth borough council is due to consider the application for 60 affordable homes this evening .
developer orbit homes declined to comment when contacted by bbc radio leicester .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: election signatures 'from pool petition '
text: election signatures 'from pool petition '

documents.title: weather warnings 'ignored ' before fatal boat crash
text: the captain of a thai speedboat that crashed killing two britons accelerated through waves after ignoring monsoon warnings , an inquest has heard .
monica o'connor , 28 , from manchester , and jason parnell , 46 , from sileby in leicestershire , died when the vessel capsized near koh samui in may 2016 .
there were 32 people on board when the crash - in which a german and a chinese national also died - occurred .
south manchester coroner 's court heard small boats were warned not to sail .
boat captain sanan sridakeow was jailed for a year and operator limited partnership angthong discovery tour was fined 15,000 thai baht ( £ 342 ) after admitting recklessness .

senior coroner for south manchester alison mutch read sentencing remarks which said the captain accelerated through the waves , sailing too close to the shore and the boat did not have the right number of life jackets for the passengers on board .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: newark hospital plans criticised by campaigners
text: campaigners have criticised plans to downgrade parts of newark hospital into an urgent treatment centre - with the services available to patients `` under review '' .
they say it 's further evidence the town is being neglected , after the hospital closed its a & e in 2011 .

paul baggaley , from the say yes to newark hospital campaign group , said : `` if you are downgrading small hospitals so they take less and less local emergencies that could be treated locally and they are becoming transfers , it is bound to be increasing pressure on the emergency care network . ''
the new proposals were discussed at nottinghamshire county council 's health scrutiny committee meeting recently .

keith girling , chairman of the committee , said sherwood forest hospitals trust and the committee had a vision to make newark hospital a `` centre of excellence '' and the plans would be a `` positive move '' .
he said the services which would be available to patients is `` under review '' .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: former mp jimmy hood dies aged 69
text: tributes are being paid to former mp and national union of mineworkers official jimmy hood , who has died aged 69 .
labour says mr hood `` courageously stood up for jobs , communities and his class '' when leading striking miners in the nottinghamshire coalfield .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: stopped driver claimed car was insured by garage
text: a driver stopped by police while on the school run in renishaw yesterday claimed they did n't have insurance because they had only just bought it and the garage had said it was already insured .
however , officers from derbyshire police 's road policing unit did not buy the excuse and seized the volkswagen golf .
renishaw .
the old 'i just bought it and the garage said it was insured ' routine .
one small child on board and on the school run to collect the next .
# seized
are you getting the traffic police mixed up with the fashion police matt ?
probably rushing back for jeremy kyle
a lot of stuff in car to say he 's only just bought it
great work what is wrong with these morons
no insurance , carrying kiddy in car .
not a responsible adult .
needs neutering .
poor kids .
what a role model parent
on the way to the gymnasium ?
or just no proper clothing .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: local sides land plum fa cup ties
text: derby county have been drawn away to manchester united in the third round of the fa cup .
gary rowett 's rams side will travel to old trafford on the weekend of 6/7 january .
there 's also a plum tie for nottingham forest , who will face arsenal at the city ground , while leicester city have been handed a trip to either fleetwood or hereford .
notts county were drawn away to brentford and mansfield will travel to wales to play cardiff city .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: travel : updates from across the region
text: travel : updates from across the region
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: it 's looking like a fairly cloudy day .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
gavin bevis and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
